muscles.name: Biceps Brachii (Short Head)
muscles.description: Inner part of the upper arm muscle; involved in bending the elbow (flexion) and rotating the forearm palm-up (supination).

muscles.name: Biceps Brachii (Long Head)
muscles.description: Outer part of the upper arm muscle; helps bend the elbow (flexion) and raise the arm forward (shoulder flexion).

muscles.name: Brachialis
muscles.description: Located underneath the biceps in the upper arm; a primary mover for bending the elbow (flexion).

muscles.name: Anterior Deltoid
muscles.description: Front section of the shoulder; responsible for lifting the arm forward (shoulder flexion) and horizontal adduction.

muscles.name: Lateral Deltoid
muscles.description: Side section of the shoulder; responsible for lifting the arm out to the side (shoulder abduction).

muscles.name: Posterior Deltoid
muscles.description: Rear section of the shoulder; responsible for pulling the arm backward (horizontal extension) and external rotation.

muscles.name: Triceps Brachii (Long Head)
muscles.description: Largest part of the triceps, on the back of the upper arm; straightens the elbow (extension) and helps pull the arm back.

muscles.name: Triceps Brachii (Lateral Head)
muscles.description: Outer part of the triceps on the back of the upper arm; straightens the elbow (extension).

muscles.name: Triceps Brachii (Medial Head)
muscles.description: Located deep on the back of the upper arm; straightens the elbow (extension).

muscles.name: Pectoralis Major (Clavicular Head)
muscles.description: The upper portion of the chest; involved in lifting the arm forward and across the body (e.g., incline press).

muscles.name: Pectoralis Major (Sternal Head)
muscles.description: The large, fan-shaped mid and lower portion of the chest; brings the arm across the body (horizontal adduction) and down (e.g., bench press, dips).

muscles.name: Pectoralis Minor
muscles.description: Small muscle located deep to the Pectoralis Major; helps pull the shoulder blade forward and down (protraction).

muscles.name: Latissimus Dorsi
muscles.description: Large V-shaped muscle on the back; responsible for pulling motions (e.g., pull-ups, rows) by bringing the arm down and back.

muscles.name: Trapezius (Upper)
muscles.description: Top part of the trapezius (neck to shoulders); primarily used for shrugging the shoulders up (elevation).

muscles.name: Trapezius (Middle)
muscles.description: Middle part of the trapezius, between the shoulder blades; pulls the shoulder blades together (retraction).

muscles.name: Trapezius (Lower)
muscles.description: Lower part of the trapezius in the mid-back; pulls the shoulder blades down (depression).

muscles.name: Rhomboids
muscles.description: Located deep to the traps, between the shoulder blades; work with the mid-traps to pull the shoulder blades together (retraction).

muscles.name: Erector Spinae
muscles.description: A group of muscles running along the spine; responsible for extending (straightening/bending back) the back.

muscles.name: Teres Major
muscles.description: Located on the upper, outer back near the armpit; assists the lats in pulling the arm down and back (adduction/extension).

muscles.name: Rectus Femoris
muscles.description: Central muscle of the quadriceps (front thigh); straightens the knee (extension) and flexes the hip.

muscles.name: Vastus Lateralis
muscles.description: Outer muscle of the quadriceps (front thigh); straightens the knee (extension).

muscles.name: Vastus Medialis
muscles.description: Inner muscle of the quadriceps (front thigh), 'teardrop' shaped near the knee; straightens the knee (extension).

muscles.name: Vastus Intermedius
muscles.description: Located deep in the quadriceps, beneath the Rectus Femoris; straightens the knee (extension).

muscles.name: Biceps Femoris
muscles.description: Outer muscle of the hamstring (back of thigh); bends the knee (flexion) and extends the hip.

muscles.name: Semitendinosus
muscles.description: One of the inner muscles of the hamstring (back of thigh); bends the knee (flexion) and extends the hip.

muscles.name: Semimembranosus
muscles.description: The other inner muscle of the hamstring (back of thigh); bends the knee (flexion) and extends the hip.

muscles.name: Gluteus Maximus
muscles.description: The largest muscle of the buttocks; powerful hip extender (e.g., standing up from a squat, thrusting).

muscles.name: Gluteus Medius
muscles.description: Located on the upper, outer side of the buttocks; moves the leg sideways (abduction) and stabilizes the pelvis.

muscles.name: Gluteus Minimus
muscles.description: Located deep to the Gluteus Medius; assists in moving the leg sideways (abduction) and stabilizing the pelvis.

muscles.name: Gastrocnemius
muscles.description: The larger, upper muscle of the calf; responsible for pointing the toes (plantarflexion), especially with a straight knee.

muscles.name: Soleus
muscles.description: Located underneath the Gastrocnemius in the calf; responsible for pointing the toes (plantarflexion), especially with a bent knee.

muscles.name: Rectus Abdominis
muscles.description: Front abdominal muscles ('six-pack'); responsible for bending the spine forward (flexion, e.g., crunches).

muscles.name: Transverse Abdominis
muscles.description: Deepest abdominal muscle, acts like a corset; stabilizes the spine and compresses the abdomen (bracing).

muscles.name: Forearm Flexors
muscles.description: Muscles on the underside (palm side) of the forearm; responsible for bending the wrist (flexion) and gripping.

muscles.name: Forearm Extensors
muscles.description: Muscles on the top (knuckle side) of the forearm; responsible for extending the wrist backward (extension).

muscles.name: Brachioradialis
muscles.description: Large muscle on the thumb-side of the forearm; assists in bending the elbow (flexion), especially with a neutral grip.

muscles.name: External Obliques
muscles.description: Outer layer of muscles on the sides of the abdomen; involved in twisting the torso (rotation) and bending sideways (lateral flexion).

muscles.name: Internal Obliques
muscles.description: Located deep to the External Obliques; assist in twisting the torso (rotation) and bending sideways (lateral flexion).

muscles.name: Adductor Magnus
muscles.description: Largest muscle of the inner thigh; pulls the leg toward the body's midline (adduction) and assists in hip extension.

muscles.name: Adductor Longus
muscles.description: Located in the upper, inner thigh; pulls the leg toward the body's midline (adduction).

muscles.name: Adductor Brevis
muscles.description: Located deep in the upper, inner thigh; pulls the leg toward the body's midline (adduction).

muscles.name: Pectineus
muscles.description: Located at the top of the inner thigh (groin); pulls the leg in (adduction) and helps lift the knee (flexion).

muscles.name: Gracilis
muscles.description: A long, thin muscle running along the inner thigh; pulls the leg in (adduction) and assists in bending the knee.

muscles.name: Tensor Fasciae Latae (TFL)
muscles.description: Small muscle on the outside of the hip (near your pocket); moves the leg sideways (abduction) and forward (flexion).

muscles.name: Iliopsoas
muscles.description: Deep hip flexor muscles connecting the spine to the thigh bone; primary muscle for lifting the knee (hip flexion).

muscles.name: Sartorius
muscles.description: Longest muscle in the body, crossing the front of the thigh; helps lift the knee and rotate the leg (e.g., sitting cross-legged).

muscles.name: Supraspinatus
muscles.description: Rotator cuff muscle located on top of the shoulder blade; helps initiate lifting the arm to the side (abduction).

muscles.name: Infraspinatus
muscles.description: Rotator cuff muscle on the back of the shoulder blade; primary mover for rotating the arm outward (external rotation).

muscles.name: Teres Minor
muscles.description: Small rotator cuff muscle below the Infraspinatus; assists in rotating the arm outward (external rotation).

muscles.name: Subscapularis
muscles.description: Rotator cuff muscle on the front (underside) of the shoulder blade; primary mover for rotating the arm inward (internal rotation).

muscles.name: Sternocleidomastoid
muscles.description: Large muscle on the side of the neck; turns the head (rotation) and flexes the neck forward.

muscles.name: Levator Scapulae
muscles.description: Muscle running from the neck to the shoulder blade; helps lift the shoulder blade (shrug) and bend the neck sideways.

muscles.name: Splenius
muscles.description: Muscles on the back of the neck; responsible for tilting the head backward (extension) and turning the head.

muscles.name: Serratus Anterior
muscles.description: Located on the side of the ribs ('boxer's muscle'); pulls the shoulder blade forward (protraction, e.g., punching motion).

muscles.name: Tibialis Anterior
muscles.description: Muscle on the front of the shin; responsible for pulling the foot and toes upward (dorsiflexion).

muscles.name: Pronator Teres
muscles.description: Located in the upper forearm; primary muscle for rotating the forearm so the palm faces down (pronation).

muscles.name: Supinator
muscles.description: Located deep in the upper forearm; primary muscle for rotating the forearm so the palm faces up (supination).
